Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room!”
Reviews.Author: LGlately
Reviews.Content: We pulled up according to our directions, but the building was listed as the Tempo Hotel. We didn't know it was also the Casa Moderna, as it was not listed. The names have not been switched over yet according to staff. Valet was adequate, our bellman George, was amazing! He showed us how to work things in our room, gave us directions, even placed our things in the closet. You have to enter up a side hallway/elevator to get to the check-in on the 3rd floor (odd set-up). The front desk agent was ok, kind of side tracked, but there is only one agent/desk for the hotel to check in and out of. The spa was closed while we were there due to water damage or renovations, so that was a bit of a bummer, but you can still get massages in your room. We had booked a Junior Suite, but they upgraded us to the Biscayne Suite automatically when we arrived, at no extra cost. The room was amazing!!! Full living area, a look out nook, floor to ceiling windows, huge bathroom with soaking tub, exquisite bed/linens, and a private balcony. There are TV's in every room, including in the bathroom mirror, which was actually really nice for getting ready, and there's no shortage of towels which I love. My only complaint was that the "Bay View" wasn't quite that great on the 8th floor and we were still close to the main road, but the room made up for it. The toiletries are Bulgari, but the shampoo/conditioners seemed cheap and the other products were adequate. We ordered breakfast from Amuse (the hotel restaurant) and it was good, but they were small portions, typical with room service. All in all, we liked the hotel and would stay there again, maybe on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Posh Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amor4Marcio
Reviews.Content: Casa Moderna is a beautiful hotel! Some of my co-workers and I stayed here to attend a convention and enjoyed our stay so much that we spent less time at the convention and more time at the hotel. It was a little hard to find but we only had to drive around twice before we figured it out. All the staff at check in were friendly, knowlegable and efficient. Andres brought all of our bags to our room, was extremly helpful making sure we had everything we needed and answered all of our questions. He is a top notch employee! The rooms are beautiful, beds are very comfortable but the bathrooms lack privacy so you should be very comfortable with who ever you travel with. The closet is very large, nice balcony and cool tv in the mirror of the bathroom. We only had the chance to enjoy breakfast in the restaurant and it was good. The eggs benedict was over-cooked but the stuffed french toast we all shared was excellent! The pool and hot tub was great! The spa was confusing as no one seemed to be on the same page as to it being under construction or not. I had called and spoke with Roxanne the manager weeks prior to book facials and massages for the five of us. She told me that the spa was under construction due to water damage to only the mens locker room. She also advised she did not have the staff to accomodate us and they were not open in the evenings on Sunday. I asked if she would be willing to accomodate us for after hours but she did not seem the least bit interested. I had to call the spa twice as no one answered the phone or returned any of my messages. The five of us were disappointed that we could not get any services in the spa. The next day when we were checking out the front desk was not overly friendly and seemed annoyed that we even asked for a tour of the spa. We never did get to see it as they said it was under renovations and even if it was complete they would not have a key. Overall this hotel is absolutely beautiful! The rooms are very clean and stocked with plenty of top notch amenities. Housekeeping is on top of everything and very quick to respond. I am hoping to return next time with my husband or a girlfriend getaway....which ever comes first.

Reviews.Title: “A Cut Above the Rest”
Reviews.Author: roseloveswine
Reviews.Content: During the first half of my trip I stayed at the Four Seasons in Miami, I'm telling you this place blows it away. The Hotel is beautiful with a modern decor yet it still had a cozy feel to it, the rooms are very spacious and the bed is unbelievably comfortable, the bathroom is quite amazing (very modern) with a television screen in the mirror. They carry Blvgari bath products and the closet can literally be another room on its own... The customer service is great and the location is quite easy to get to.I will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but a couple of flaws”
Reviews.Author: ibrag
Reviews.Content: The Tempo is a condominium and a hotel the hotel itself looks very elegant and the rooms I beautiful so at $300 a night I felt it was a nice hotel. Unfortunately the biggest let down for me was the internet it is very weak, the first night it did not work and the next morning when it did work it kept coming in and out. I have to say that this put a really bad taste in my mouth, in this day and age and paying $300+ per night you expect fast and reliable internet. I when to the front desk first night but nothing could be done. In the morning I called the reception and she told me that she will have someone restart the server. If the internet is not important for you then the hotel is really nice great view nice amenities are nice Bvlgari toiletries, (though they were not replenished again a letdown ) nice big TV, the hotel is in a nice position close to down town and a great view of the port. There are a couple of small let downs for this type of hotel one to me was major which was the internet. The second is the service directory is very tacky and is more for some cheap motel rather then this elegant place. For me the internet is very Important to me. The directory and the replenishing of toilets I can live with, though for that kind of pricing around $350 a night I think they could make the improvements. I will not stay there again unless I was 100% sure the internet was fixed or upgraded. However it is a nice hotel people nice rooms beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jill L
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel through our local airfare company because they were offering a deal. I was so surpised by the wonderful staff and the rooms. The junior suite that we booked was huge, with a beautiful view of the port. Our valet was fantastic and the food couldn't have been better. I no longer need to look for a place to stay when I'm going to be in Miami, they only drawback is that if you have a balcony room, the road noise can be a bit loud. Overall it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at Tempo”
Reviews.Author: Figui2012
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room,great staff and great service! Itâ€™s centrally located near everything in Miami. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay there. We found a discount rate so it wasn't expensive for us. The restaurant is amazing, our room was huge, very modern, super clean, very comfortable. Amazing views to the Miami bay, also used the pools and the gym. Was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not for families ! be aware.”
Reviews.Author: blueBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: Hello, I feel responsabile because I choose this hotel and for that reason IÂ´m writing this review. I booked this hotel, based on the excellent reviews for my entire family. I have my Apt near to the hotel so I didnÂ´t use the facilities. My family, a group of 15 arrived a week ago and stayed for 5 nights. The hotel is beautiful, and the rate was very good (includes wifi, amenities and parking). The area is walkable but a car is mandatory. Why I said this hotel is not for families ? first of all they donÂ´t have connecting rooms, so the families that booked 2 rooms because they have little kids (Ages 6,5 & 4) had a hard time trying to figure how they should split. The second thing and most annoying, is that the bathroom has no door, and the shower is made of cristal glass, so nobody can pass nearby while you are in the shower, very very uncomfortable situation. This hotel suits for couples. The rooms are big and very nice, the view over Biscayne bay is great and the restaurant is very good. The fitness center is well-equipped, the pool area is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, rather pricy and not so good location”
Reviews.Author: jegerenlampe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in downtown Miami and there is not really anything around the hotel. It might be good for a business traveller but as we were on vacation we regret that we did not book something on South Beach. We paid 240 dollars of night (including all taxes) - excluding breakfast - and found it quite expensive for what we got, but too be honest we don't have so much to compare with in Miami (as it is our first visit) and maybe Miami is just that pricy. The room were nice and the hotel have a nice fitness center and a nice pool (which however are in the shade most of the day due to the buildings around the hotel). Breakfast was nice but very expensive and it was not even a buffet - and the problem is that you need to walk 10-15min to get to the harbour area where you can get breakfast if you don't want it in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in downtown Miami!”
Reviews.Author: lulubella515
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Tempo was pure heaven...this boutique hotel is a hidden treasure. Me and a friend went in December for a long weekend for some R&R and we were not disappointed. The restuarant in the hotel was great, they need to advertise more because the resturant was very empty. The bed was so comfotable it was like sleeping on a cloud! The location is a few blocks from the port of Miami and Bayside, a shopper's dream with lots of places to eat there. We got upgraded to a jr. suite and the room was spectacular...I had a spa treatment while staying at the Tempo and Gabriel took care of all the tension in my neck and shoulders. Danielle and Addie at the front desk made our stay more pleasurable. Overall the people working there couldn't be more accommodating. I definately would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to go to Miami for a long weekend getaway. It's 10-15mins from the Miami airport and it's more relaxing than South Beach. Don't get me wrong I like South Beach, but I rather stay where it's not all the action, I get enough of that in New York City where I live, sometimes I like the peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “This place was GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: ES200
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the nicest I have ever stayed in. The rooms were very European. The batroom was unbelievable. There was a tv built into the mirror. The bellman was the most helpful I have ever experienced. The bed waas breat and the decor was outstanding. The $34 parking chaarge wass a little much however.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet luxury in the heart of Downtown.”
Reviews.Author: bird1010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days before Christmas. This was a couples trip with my sister and her husband, my husband, and myself. The rooms were huge and lovely. Great bathrooms, toiletries were the same I had in Paris at a great hotel. Downtown Miami is brimming with really interesting and cool restaurants. We never even went to S. Beach. Michael's Genuine for lunch is very chic and not to be missed. Moses gave us an excellent suggestion in Pupbelly and was more than helpful. I had several spa treatments and they were all lovely. Breakfast was included with our rate and it was great every day. We had lunch delivered by the pool one day and it was good. The beds here are some of the most comfortable I have ever experienced. I would love to know their secret. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yoswamp
Reviews.Content: I did a little research because of the bed bug situation in all the big cities. This is a newer hotel, very European look and feel. I loved the entire layout, I ended up staying a third nite. Each room has a large balcony, mine was overlooking the Bay and the City. I knew there was a parking fee, so I took a taxi instead, plus it's just easier than fighting traffic or getting lost. It was a very large room, with a comfy bed. Very friendly staff, plus the hotel offers many services so you don't have to leave. It is not cheap but I am a firm believer you get what you pay for, totally worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: alicat84
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night before departing on a cruise, and we only did that because we got a very very good deal. I would not pay full price for this hotel. It looks great, very modern and clean. We were even offered a free back massage at reception. However, the whole hotel feels like a library. I didn't feel we could raise our voices above a whisper at any stage. Even the pool area felt dead. The bed was AMAZING, so comfortable, and the room was quite large. The tv in the bathroom mirror was quite cool, but ultimately pointless, as you could only see it if you were straight in front of it. The shower and the toilet were around the corner so I don't see what benefit it was. The thing that really baffled me was that there was no door to the bathroom! Even the most intimate couples can do with a few minutes privacy a day. They could have at least put a glass door in, if they were worried about getting light into the bathroom (as there was no window), but removing the door completely is just plain stupid in my opinion. While sitting in bed, you could see the toilet straight in front of you. They only view we had from our window was the car-park building across the road, so we just kept the blinds shut, but our friends had a room with a balcony at the front of the hotel and the view was lovely. We could see all the ships docked in the port in front of us. When we returned from dinner, a very nice girl at reception said she would book a car for when we were leaving the next day. She even suggested that they could arrange a late check-out (just an hour or so) until the car arrived. The next morning our friends rang down to confirm the late check-out, with no problems, and so I rang down to do the same. The woman I got at reception actually laughed at me, in a really condescending manner, saying that they were full. I don't care how fancy your hotel is, you do not laugh at patrons who have a perfectly reasonable request, that was offered by one of your own colleagues less than twelve hours previously. I wish I had taken her name because I would be complaining to her manager. Ever other member of staff had been extremely pleasant and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: larnerdarren
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. My partner and I stayed here for 2 nights and we loved it. Very modern and stylish. Huge Room (905) with a big balcony overlooking Biscayne Blvd. Tastefully decorated. Probably the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. Superb bathroom/showeroom, but water did tend to seep under glass door if you had a long shower. Twin basins with a mirror and built in TV. There was also a walk in closet. Small kitchen area with coffee machine etc. It was more like an apartment than a hotel room. Great location for us as it was fairly easy to get to from the airport and walking distance of bayside shopping restaurants bars etc. There is a bus stop on the other side of the road where you can get to South Beach in about 10 minutes for $2. There is also a metro mover stop outside the hotel which is free, but we found it a little confusing to use. There are 2 lovely swimming pools on the 14th floor roof top. A sunrise one and a sun set one as well as a hot tub and a spa, although the spa was closed the sun/mon we were here.

Reviews.Title: “Could be good- depends on your needs”
Reviews.Author: TravelgalCathy
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal on Expedia for this "resort" and for a car rental. I had originally wanted to stay in South Beach, but the price of 3 nights at this hotel plus the car was less than 2 nights at a hotel in South Beach, and the hotel is located off the first exit across the MacArthur Causeway, also close to the downtown area. My friend and I were looking for a nice place to stay - a well-appointed room, and we got that. If you are looking for room service, a lively lobby bar, restaurant, and pool, you will be disappointed. The Tempo is part of a building of condos, so it appears the "resort" is side business in a down economy. Our room was quiet, spacious (walk in closet, large bathroom with built in TV in the mirror!), with a balcony and air-conditioning. The room and check-in areas were very nicely decorated and modern. There was only valet parking, but it wasn't too busy when we were there. I will mention our AC wasn't fully working, and it took them a day and a half to have someone actually look at it. They offered to move us to another room, but we declined the offer. It wasn't extremely hot, so we didn't "sweat it" so to speak.

Reviews.Title: “Center of it all, never felt so appreciated!”
Reviews.Author: mrcruz730
Reviews.Content: Across from Airlines Arena this place is now under new ownership and does it ever show! Rooms are very clean, smiles throughout check in, and many thanks upon check out! It's nice to feel appreciated! We walked to a show at the arena nearby, frequented to Bayside shopping center nearby, and cabbed it through South Beach and the rest of Miami! Infinity pool overlooks the Port! From what I understand, they are working diligently to consistently improve an already exciting location. Give it a try, I'm sure you'll be ready to stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Art Decor Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MTSZ_11
Reviews.Content: The Tempo hotel is awesome. I almost did not want to leave my suite, beautiful 21 feet balcony overlooking the Miami skyline. Decor is clean and classic, And Yes without a doubt I would love to stay at the Tempo on 1100 Biscayne again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property-highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: BarleyJack
Reviews.Content: Spent last night in this wonderful hotel, hated to leave LOL. We were booked for one night after a cruise last week. We were fortunate to be able to have an early check in, and even received an upgrade. We were given a corner balcony room on the sixth floor with amazing views of the bay and downtown. The room is decked out in high end finishes, and the bed was amazing. Front desk service was great-very friendly. Be aware of the bathroom however-if you are shy or are not traveling with family you might find the set up a bit disconcerting. That aside, the bath is very spa like with a large, deep soaking tub and rain shower head. It was a relaxing way to end our cruise vacation. The hotel is within walking distance to the Bayside Marketplace, where you'll find may options for shopping and dining, as well as live entertainment. Would most definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Resort with 5+ Star Employees”
Reviews.Author: Nikki4
Reviews.Content: Even though this is an incredibly beautiful resort, what we will remember is the staff. Lorna, one of the concierges, helped me plan our schedule even before we left with e-mails and phone calls. She was extremely helpful. We also enjoyed our time in the bar talking with Juan who is a foodie and drink expert like my husband. We ate at their restaurant, Amuse, all four nights! Each evening we would plan to go elsewhere, but then, when it came dinner time, we would always get drawn back downstairs to Amuse. The food is excellent and Luis, our waiter, became like a family member. Danny, the chef, does amazing things with food and we found the portions to be large and reasonably priced. We had a corner room with gorgeous views of Key Biscayne and we loved leaving the door open and having the breezes sail through the room.... and this was late November! My favorite bathroom feature was the large magnifying mirror to use for contact lenses and make-up. There were lots of towels.... far many than we could ever use and showering looking over the bay was a treat. The Bvlgari bath products were wonderful, too. The closet was larger than a lot of motel rooms.... plenty of room for my husband to keep his items..."spread out" while keeping the room itself neat. The king bed had top of the line duvets and sheets. The room was also very quiet considering it is on a busy street. The only negative, and it is small, is that the fluorescent lighting does not light the room well and it is impossible to read in bed by those llights.

Reviews.Title: “Tempo Rock Resort - - Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Sealovers2
Reviews.Content: I booked this for a pre-cruise night departing from the Port of Miami. The hotel, describes itself as 'boutique'. Don't let that term fool you. It is not small and cozy; it is located within one of Miami's most beautiful skyscrapers that is also contains condominiums. Upon ariving, the bellman and concierge took care of everything, moving our luggage from the car and telling us it would be in our room. The concierge personally escorted us to the Reception Desk which is located on the third floor. It is a very contemporary, yet posh building and facilities. I won this room through Priceline (Downtown-Resort) and did have to pay an additional $20 resort fee. I called ahead and requested a balcony to ensure we had a view of the port. That was an additional well-spent $15. Our room was on the 14th floor facing Biscayne Blvd (U.S. Route 1) that allowed us to watch 'our ship come in' to port at 5 a.m. the next morning. The bath facilities and fixtures are the best, with a soaking tub in addition to a separate rain shower, all enclosed behind a glass walls and door. The double sinks do face out into the room through a large opening, affording little privacy there. The bed was very comfortable and dressed in top quality linens. The large walk-in closet with shelves and drawers was very nice. This very large room had a vestibule area upon entering that contained a wet bar, small frig, and 4 cup coffee maker with Starbucks coffee (also available in the morning downstairs at the Reception area). Room service for dinner was very good, although pricey. The hotel is located within a comfortable walking distance of Bayside with lots of restaurants and souvenir shops. We were there on a Tuesday night and never saw or heard any other hotel guests. It was a great stay at a luxurious, quiet hotel that was very conveniently located for a pre-cruise night.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel in Miami with beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: MrEZTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Tempo is a little boutique hotel located in downtown Miami. The decor is beautiful and the rooms are both spacious and conveniently laid out with walk in closets and functional bathrooms. The view is excellent. Service needs a little work.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: momof2inva_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a weekend getaway in Miami at a luxury hotel without paying luxury prices. We booked this hotel through Luxury Link and were not disappointed. The room was beautiful, the bed was exceptionally comfortable and the bathroom was top notch. I don't know that we needed a tv in the bathroom built into the mirror, but it was a really cool feature! The staff was terrific - everyone was friendly and very helpful. If you are taking a cruise, going to an event at the American Airlines Arena, or going to the theatre, this hotel is in a fantastic location. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Cdntraveller060
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through Rock resorts through a sale. A bit apprehensive when I got an email stating that the hotel management had changed. We arrived several hours late after a rainy cab ride from the Ft Lauderdale airport. Stressed when the cab driver had never heard of the hotel. The front desk is on the 3rd floor - slightly unusual arrangement but works I guess. They didn't have the room that I had booked but offered to upgrade us to a suite. Let me say that it was an amazing room - great view of biscayne bay from the water view balcony. Incrdible bathroom. Very accommodating to our requests for a cot and extra towels etc. Room service breakfast was also great if expensive. Walk able to the bayside mall and the arena where the Miami heat play despite the rain. All in all a great stay. Highly recommended. We didn't use the pool which was on the top of the building - very windy but a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel for our Girls trip”
Reviews.Author: princesa782
Reviews.Content: OMG Tempo was amazing!!! From when we first got there until the day we left everything and everyone was excellent!! It was me and 4 of my girl friends taking a much needed vacay and we couldn't have asked for a better place than Tempo. Rooms were gorgeous!! We had 2 deluxe rooms with double beds and there was more than enough space for us all. The walk in closets were perfect for our clothes and the robes and slippers were soooo appreciated. The rain shower felt so good and looking out to the bay while showering was an experience in itself. The location was perfect, only a cab or bus ride into South Beach. The views from the balcony were awesome and the balcony itself was huge!!! I spent many hours there just sitting out and enjoyinh the sun and the view. Everyone from the bellmen to front desk were very accomodating and willing to make our stay more enjoyable. On our check out date we had about 5 hours after check out until our flight and were not looking forward to carrying our luggage anywhere we went. The hotel held our bags free of charge and even let us use their ammenities until it was time to leave. The only complaint I had about the hotel was the fact they have no vending/ice machines. Waking up thirsty with no option to get a soda sucked but front desk sent up ice and water when we called so it wasn't too bad. Plus there is a convenience store next door so we just stocked up on soda and snacks the rest of the trip. All in all the place is amazing and we're already planning our trip back to Tempo!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel But Service Could Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: tarheelrn2000
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I got a great deal & it was close to American Airlines Arena. I had a rough flight & cabs in Miami suck & are way overpriced! When I got to the hotel the hostess upgraded my room. The room was awesome! It had a huge private balcony, electric mirror, soaking tub, excellent closet space...I could go on & on. Nice pool. Didnt get to use the gym or spa but nice that Tempo offers them. The housekeeping, room service, & reception staff were excellent but the 1st floor doorman / staff were awful. There was no assistance with doors, luggage, or cabs / transportation. If I have to go back to Miami I would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A treat for weary travellers”
Reviews.Author: mumof2wifeof1
Reviews.Content: Relaxing,helpful and sooo comfortable......We cannot say enough good things about the Tempo, Friendly staff (especially Lorna) who helped us organise everything from day trips to the evergaldes to getting our laundry sent out and returned and with very mimimum of fuss, free transport across the road with a soft and comforting surrounds to lay your head at night. Have already recommended this hotle to our travel agent back here in Aus. Would and have highly recommended this hotel to other Aussies planning a holiday in Miami. An excellent value for money resort who goes above and beyond in pleasing their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Biscayne Beauty”
Reviews.Author: vetadst5
Reviews.Content: The biscayne suite was definitely a wonderful find. There was plenty of space, a nice view, and extremely comfortable bedding. The location was very convenient especially with the free travel system located right next to the hotel. We were able to leave our vehicle parked for most of the stay. The pool has a beautiful view. The wet and dry saunas were enjoyable . Unfortunately, there weren't many available spa reservations available so I was unable to schedule a massage. The lounge was enjoyable and the bartender Elvis definitely made some refreshing drinks. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Mo.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Treasure That I'm Thrilled I Stumbled Upon...”
Reviews.Author: VacationLover1124
Reviews.Content: My stay at Tempo Miami exceeded my expectations. The pictures on the website are a true reflection of the hotel. I stayed in the Junior Suite and not only was it spacious, the view of the city was amazing. The co-owner, Hector introduced himself and provided valuable recommendations for Things to Do in the city, as well as in the neighborhood of the hotel. Elvis, the bartender at Amuse was very charming at made delicious drinks. You have to try his cucumber/lemonade alcoholic drink. I can't wait to go back and have a few more!! Overall, ridiculously clean, superior service by the Staff, perfect location and great value. I will definitely be a frequent customer at Tempo Miami!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine H
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Tempo Miami from the 24th to the 27th. What an amazing hotel! When we checked in we were greeted and informed about all of the hotel amenities. I didn't get the girl at the front desks name but she was spanish and short (if that helps) lol..SHE WAS GREAT. very sweet. We went to our room which was a deluxe double. The only thing that is awkward about the room is the shower/tub area. It is completely exposed so we had to organize shower times but it wasn't a huge deal. Would've been great if it was a romantic trip! Our room was large and we had a really nice balcony that we left open for the most part to get fesh air. We didn't spend alot of time in the room but the time we did spend sleeping was great. The beds were incredibly comfortable and clean. The room in general was very clean you could tell the hotel is new. I don't suggest walking about the balcony barefoot though..lol my feet were filthy after a few minutes out there. W We did go to the pool/hot tub at one point which was very quiet except for a few children who were throwing rocks into the pool and diving in to get them (super annoying!) but, obviously not the hotel's fault. We had about 2 hours of uninterrupted hot tub time and it was super relaxing. We called down ten minutes before we wanted to leave to have a cab ready and they always were! I literally have no real complaints I had an amazing time in miami and I felt like my stay was everything I expected. I'm planning another trip in november with friends and we will be staying at the tempo again. The only thing I could possibly suggest is if a customer tells you it's their birthday (it was mine!) you should do something special for them! I know when I told the Ritz last year they sent up a tray of cookies..it's the little things like that that make a difference!

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Lady_V808
Reviews.Content: I would give this hotel five stars but when we were leaving one of the men at the checkout counter was rude to us. We were waiting for our car in the lounge area after we checked out and the guy did not like that we were waiting in the lounge area since we had already checked out and I felt like that was pretty rude and it took away from my great experience. Other then that, the hotel was beautiful and it's a 10 minute drive from south beach which is nice if you have a car. I also don't like that you have to pay a nightly $30 resort fee but I got a good rate at hotels.com so I wasn't too upset. Up until I left my customer service and experience had actually been great. The hotel rooms are huge, we had a nice balcony, the rooms are clean and very pretty. The pools and pool area is very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Hotel- I would give it 3.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: VCG
Reviews.Content: My business colleague and I had to be in Miami for a business meeting. So we needed suite which had a living area where we could have the meeting. After a lot of research I found that Tempo was a good option. I wanted the Biscayne Suite. The hotel website had a rate of $316. Same was available for $216 on hotels.com. So check that website before booking at the hotel. We got into Miami at around 830 PM, rented the car and drove. The hotel is less than 10 minutes from the airport. It forms the lower part of an apartment building so keep that in mind. The building does have a fancy light on the side and so is easily identifiable from a distance. The location is on Biscayne Blvd but the access is from a side street. The hotel has valet parking. The check in is on level 3. The hotel does not seem to have much staff. When we got the to the hotel the valet and security guards seem to be the same. They were the same people who even got the luggage to the lobby. Dont expect much of a lobby. It is a small desk on a floor. The hotel also charges $30 per night as resort fee. This is a new ridiculous charge a lot of hotels have started. The fee was apparently for water!!!! and free high speed internet (a joke as the speed was less than even 1 MBPS). DIal up lines are faster. If they want to charge more money, just increase the rate. Dont ding customers with these ridiculous extras in the name of resort fee. And by the way, they dont give you evian or any of those fancy water bottles. It is one of their own bottles where they claim they give purified drinking water and for environment purposes reuse the glass bottles. No way to verify if the water is actually purified or from the tap. The biscayne suite was pretty large. More like a 1 BR apartment. There was a large living area with an L shaped couch. You could use the couch to sleep but it does not turn into a bed. So if there are 4 of you, forget being able to use the sofa as a bed. The room has a large dining table with 6 chairs. There is a small kitchen area and a wall mounted flat screen TV in front of the couch. The room was good size with a king sized bed. The bathroom was also quite large. Only problem was that there was no door to the bathroom. The shower area is all glass. So keep that in mind. Stay was overall OK. Room was nice. There was no exceptional service and so i am not sure why others at TA have been so kind to the place. It qualifies as a nice serviced apartment and surely not as a high end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room”
Reviews.Author: vin71
Reviews.Content: I visited earlier this year, and felt that the hotel did what it said on the tin. It was well located, the service was fine although I really only checked in and then was out most of the time and did not sample many amenities. It was a trip to visit friends, and needed a base. The room was very comfortable, great bathroom and a view of the cruise ships coming and going. I would return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing clean rooms and great service, definitely will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Johanna P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort for 4 nights and absoulutely enjoyed everything about it. The rooms were super modern, clean, and fun. The location was great, walking distance to downtown and shops. By bus, it is about 15 min to South beach area. The staff treated us so well and were very service based. They also have a neat restaurant called Amuse in the resort and it was delicious. The pools are awesome and spa services as well. Thanks again for a great time Tempo! peace.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: gferraez
Reviews.Content: Great hotel it's locations it's very central and perfect if you are attending a event at the American airlines arena, the pool and gym have a great view and it's close to all the mayor shopping centers, we got the junior suite we love it very romantic and Cousy the restaurant was the only thing that left us wanting more the food was very pricy and defiantly not as good for abated payed

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: LenaCarson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely loved this place! Everyone was really nice and helpful. If you need help please talk to Moses! He gave us the best advice on shows to see and never led us wrong. The room was amazing and we had a nice view of the downtown area and the water. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it so much, we stayed three extra days!!!”
Reviews.Author: Baldwingirl
Reviews.Content: We originally were going to go to Savannah for three days after Miami, but we loved our room so much, we didn't want to leave! We had the fantastic junior suite others have raved about. We adored the room and the pool. We both got massages at the spa and thought they were terrific. Moises the bellman was a gem. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel in downtown”
Reviews.Author: rudolf51
Reviews.Content: Tempo is an awesome boutique hotel, with a contemporary design. The room was huge, also was the balcony. We could see the cruise ships come and go from the balcony. The view is simply breath taking day and night. The bathroom is amazing with a tv build into the mirrow, a tube and a big shower. The service at the hotel was great, everyone was friendly, knowledgable and helpful. We have had a wunderful time at this downtown hotel and we had a great price for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Sas0920
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Tempo for a weekend in May and I was blown away. Best hotel I have personally ever stayed at. We saw a deal for their Junior Suite and just booked it. This room was huge there was literally a walk in closet larger than most home walk - ins. There were 2 bathrooms one was a 1/2 bath which I was happy about cause the half bath as completely private as opposed to the one in the larger bathroom which was not. The shower and bathtub are both in this enclosed section that is see through (if that bothers you) but with a view to die for of the bay. Our room faced the bay which was gorgeous at night!! The outdoor terrace was HUGE pretty private and just felt posh. The bed was super comfy, very luxurious linens and not to mention 2 huge flat screen tv's. The hotel was very quiet and felt very private which I favor. The pool area was also very quiet 2 small pools 2 large pools one shaded lap pool.The gym looked fully equiped and the spa I can not comment on since I did not visit. We were checking out the residences by the end of our trip and they were adorable but very pricey. We also met Mario Cantone who was staying at Tempo at the time. My only issue was the area around the hotel was kind of creepy at night. Weird people walking around...Not many kids at hotel but I'm sure completely accomodating if you did take. I will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Surprised...Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: LolaFree
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a little surprise get away for Kartel before departing for our cruise. Initally I was looking to rent a condo on the beach, but with the lack of responses I began searching a hotel and came across the Tempo. I selected this hotel because of the close proximity to the Port of Miami. Getting to the hotel is a little confusing as our navigation didn't find the street. So, I called and spoke with Patricia whom was kind and very patient as she directed us to the hotel. The hotel is located on 11th street and US 1 (Biscayne Blvd). The hotel is located inside the Marquis Residences. You'll see "MARQUIS" in the water feature when entering. The parking is free when you advise the parking attendant you are staying at the Tempo Hotel. There are two lobby entries, which was a little confusing, but the gentleman directed us to the next lobby as that is the entrance for the Tempo. Enter the set of right doors and take the elevators to the 3rd floor which is the lobby of the Tempo. We were welcomed with warm smiles and pleasantries by Patricia and David. We were offered the lime water, which was very refreshing. Patricia had all paperwork & keys ready. I simply reviewed and signed paperwork. David introduced himself to Kartel and arranged delivery of luggage and item needed from our vehicle. We were in our room within 10 minutes after arriving. I reserved the Biscayne Suite and was given the Biscayne Suite on the highest floor. The suite was BEAUTIFUL......absolutely BEAUTIFUL.....I didn't expect the suite to be as spacious as it was. The views of Miami were lovely from the suite and we watched the cruise ships come in. Even with the rain and night skies, it was beautiful. David returned with our luggage and set it up for us in the dressing area. He then gave us a thorough overview of the room and its functionalities. He stayed so long with us, i wanted to ask him if he had other people to tend to, because he was truly interested in ensuring we are not to lift one finger for anything and WHATEVER we need he'll be there to care for us. He was even interested in about our international love and how we met, which I thought was nice. Kartel is interested in obtaining a pilot's license. Well, David was kind enough to bring Kartel printed information about places where he can begin lessons in central Florida. On another note, David is a super friendly, very intelligent man. He really should be a curator in a museum some where because he is a chock full of knowledge about everything. He really enjoys his position and meeting new people and you can tell. He is an exceptional human being. We ordered room service the first night because Kartel was so excited about the room he didn't want to leave. (LOL) The restaurant Amuse is located on the 3rd floor in the hotel. The food was delicious and made with great care, BUT it was expensive to me as I'm a vegetarian so I didn't purchase any meat and Kartel ate seafood. $180.00 for two small dinners, 2 cocktails, and a dessert we shared. The food came quickly despite the restaurant having a party for Cinco de Mayo. The lady was very kind and set up the food for us on the table. Checkout was just as quick as checking in. We were offered some more delicious lime water with some treats, which we did enjoy again. When we arrived downstairs, our car was waiting for us and the parking attendant took our luggage. Overall, this was a great experience. The place was exceptionally clean, beautifully decorated, and the service was paramount. I totally suggest you book directly through the hotel's website as they always have great deals.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience- Superior Service at every level or facit of Resort!”
Reviews.Author: JasonEvans
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled into the valet area and parked my business partners Rover, to the time I was seated at the very warm and "open" approach to your average Check in desk where I was quickly greeted, welcomed, and given a beverage, the staff seemed to rally around each aspect of my needs and questions. The rooms as well as the detailed and very informative tour of my room- offered and beautifully explained by David in Gveruest Services was spot on and extremely helpful. Found the rooms to be in immaculate condition and the amenitities equally impressive. From the rooms I ventured down to where I hoped to be spending the jist of my stay-pool area and Spa. There I was greeted by two AMAZING and extremely helpful employees of the Spa, Sarah Lee and Lily. Having explained I['d never stepped foot in a spa Sarah Lee began my tour and informative session where she highlighted and pointed out all features, options and of course directions in which to gain access into the pool areas as well as the spas, locker rooms and extras. She was so incredibly helpful that I decided to finally bite the bullet and purchased one of the amzing treatments offered and in doing so, has made me a believer in the old potions and lotions. Both her and Lilly are an amazing asset to the facility and again, should be commended for their above and beyond customer service approach and attitudes in regards to their positions there. It's because of my experience with them, that I now have a totally new and more positive view of just how awesome spas and spa treatments can enrich peoples lives, health and over all appearances and well being. I will definately recommend this Resort and all it has to offer when and any time I'm back in the Miami area, it will be my first choice in stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love love love!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: meshamouse
Reviews.Content: Love this place!!!! Had a wonderful girls weekend!!! Staff very nice! Eco friendly, cleaning, and balcony view is beautiful!!! Worth every penny!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent getaway from reality”
Reviews.Author: selmagholson
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for our Miami getaway because of the great reviews it already has.Upon arrival we were shown the1 bedroom suite,we loved it so much we upgraded.The view of the bay and the arena from the balcony was immaculate.Everything was excellent from the friendliness of the staff to the cleanliness of the establishment to the promt room and valet service.We will definately recommend this resort to friends and family!We hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for cruise terminal, unique room”
Reviews.Author: GTechMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before our cruise and it was wonderful. It is a $10 cab ride to the port. The hotel has an amazing staff and the room was unique and beautiful. We rented a car at the Miami airport and went sightseeing. We took the car back to the airport and then rode a taxi back to the hotel. The fare was approximately $21 to the airport. The roof top pool and gym were also spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “I love the whole trip especially the spa”
Reviews.Content: The entire weekend was a wonderful escape from reality to be pampered and treated like royalty. I expecially must commend the stafff at the spa, Lily was such a pleasure and was worried and ensured that everything was great and the massue Roxanne lifted my aching body and spirit. I thank them all for helping me to escape and recharge. I felt like family there

Reviews.Title: “Not this time!”
Reviews.Author: joparke
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel's location for attending games at the American Airlines Arena - it is perfect and if you can get a good rate, take this hotel but do not expect too much. I stayed ere last year and was impressed and did note that their restaurant lacked variety and staff. On this occasion there is now a $30 resort fee! Which is suppose to include wifi internet, 2 bottle of water, newspaper and use of the gym. Well, I never received any news papers on my stay and the internet service is the worst I have ever experienced in a hotel in the USA. I was unable to get online for the majority of the time and even when you go on it would be slow and then you lost connection shortly thereafter. Calling downstairs for assistance was a waste of time. Only on check out when I mention it again did that person truthful acknowledge that they were having issues, others would just saying they did not have any complaints about their internet. If I do not have access to the internet, I am not a happy person! On Thursday when we went to the restaurant before the game, they turned us back saying that they chef advised her not to take anymore orders!!! She was the only server it seems with a man at the bar. The restaurant maybe had 20 guests. Again, not happy. On check in, they tried to give me a deluxe room although I paid for a Premium deluxe room. If I did not stay at the hotel before, I would not have known the difference. I had to show her the travelocity confirmation and then she checked her system again. I am not sure if that was a genuine mistake or something else! Note there is a huge difference between the room, so please make sure that you verify your information before accepting the room. After all is said and done, the room was fabulous and the staff friendly. I am looking into going back to Miami this weekend but I highly doubt I will stay at this hotel until they get their internet issues fixed. I will spend the additional 5 mins walking to the arena and stay at a regular chain where I can get a fab buffet breakfast instead for the same rate!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: MissSC1
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks exactly the same as the website pics. Clean, modern and spacious. The staff are very friendly, especially Anthony on the front desk! Although the bathroom doesn't have a door, the toilette does, but otherwise u have to be very comfortable with who you're staying with. The hotel restaurant is rather pricey but there's a very nice Chinese restaurant just outside called miss yip - very tasty and good value for money. There's also a 24hr petrol station nearby which sells snacks, fruit, juice, wine&beer (no other alchs!) South beach approx 10mins away, costing $15 taxi but there's a direct bus for $2. taxi from Mia airport costs a flat rate of $24. There is a resort of $30 a day and also security fee of $500 which they don't actually charge unless needs be. But all in all the hotel is gorgeous along with 2outside pools n 2hot baths plus sauna and steam rooms (although we didn't use them) the views are beautiful of the city at night. Bayside mall 10mins walk away really nicerestaurants (bubba gump) and souvenirs etc. So all in all SUPERB!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: MissSC1
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks exactly the same as the website pics. Clean, modern and spacious. The staff are very friendly, especially Anthony on the front desk! Although the bathroom doesn't have a door, the toilette does, but otherwise u have to be very comfortable with who you're staying with. The hotel restaurant is rather pricey but there's a very nice Chinese restaurant just outside called miss yip - very tasty and good value for money. There's also a 24hr petrol station nearby which sells snacks, fruit, juice, wine&beer (no other alchs!) South beach approx 10mins away, costing $15 taxi but there's a direct bus for $2. taxi from Mia airport costs a flat rate of $24. There is a resort of $30 a day and also security fee of $500 which they don't actually charge unless needs be. But all in all the hotel is gorgeous along with 2outside pools n 2hot baths plus sauna and steam rooms (although we didn't use them) the views are beautiful of the city at night. Bayside mall 10mins walk away really nicerestaurants (bubba gump) and souvenirs etc. So all in all SUPERB!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: alwaysandrea
Reviews.Content: Other reviews stated that the hotel is old, I totally disagree. Everything was up to date, clean, staff was pretty friendly. Only thing is this is not the hotel stay at if u came to Miami to party, or hang out in hotel and mingle, because it is practiclly deserted. Not alot of people or things going on here at all. Even pool was always empty. But very clean, good location in downtown miami, considering most hotels on south beach are either VERY exspensive or dingy. We had a junior suite with balcony, large walk in closet, nice modern bathroom overall very nice room. We did find out the rapper Trina, a few athletes and soon rapper Drake live in the condos connected to hotel, just a little FYI if you are a fan lol.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY DISGUSTING EXPERIENCE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: taleenz
Reviews.Content: All I have to say about this hotel is WOW!!! Please do not get the wrong idea. I am in no way using the word WOW to describe how great my experience was, but rather to let EVERY SINGLE PERSON reading reviews on trip advisor to know how disgusted I am from this hotel. From the second we stepped foot through the doors to the third floor, we were welcomed by the sound of a screeching fire alarm asking us to evacuate the building. Lorna the lady at the concierge desk did not even look up to acknowledge the fact that we were there. I was the one who said hello, and received a rude hello back. No mention whatsoever about if we were to evacuate or not. In any case, she proceeded to check us in without one word about what to expect, where to go, or what amenities we had access to! She literally said NOTHING!!! To top it all off, she continued to have a full on conversation with another employee while we checked in. Since it was my first time in Miami, I was hoping to get some pointers as far as what we can do, but I got nothing. She didnt tell us about the spa, pool or anything that we can expect to see. When I first booked this room, I called in 4 different times asking about certain things before I actually booked my room. I had 3 main things I wanted to have on my trip. I wanted to be in front of a beach, have a balcony to enjoy the view of the water and the sounds of waves, and I wanted to be close to South Beach!! Well I was lied to about the fact that my room would have an ocean view, and I was about 10 minutes ($25) cab ride each way to South Beach!! Had I known I was going to spend this much money on cabs, I would have rather booked a $500 a night room that would have given me everything I wanted, not lied to me, and given me the service that 4 or 5 star hotels are supposed to give their guests. One other thing that pissed me off to know end was the fact that the hotel told me upon booking that they would charge a $100 deposit as soon as i booked the room, and charged the rest 24 hours before I got there. Well they charged the full amount about 5 days before I got there. Therefore, even if I wanted to switch hotels, I would not have been able to. When I told LORNA about this, she told me that i was wrong. I told her to check it before she talks and I was right. I was not compensated for this, nor was I given an apology!!! THEY DID NOTHING!!! Then I was told that they would be charging me $100 more per night as a deposit. Although, deposits are standard for hotel check in, $400 seemed high and they had not told me about this. When I said something, they said that its hotel policy and that its written in my reservation contract. I told them well it was also written that I was to be charged 24 hours before I get there and yet that wasn't the case. They did not say anything except shrug. I asked for a high floor at least and they said that they were all booked. Funny thing because i might have seen a total of 2 guest s the entire time I was there. All of this happened within the first 10 minutes of arriving. As you can tell, they left a bad taste in my mouth. The hotel has one employee doing the job of four different positions. Room service, housekeeping, concierge, and front desk are all run by one person at a time. Because of this, the calls often went to voicemail. LORNA was extremely rude throughout the entire time I was there. Not once was I treated like a paying guest! I asked for advil one night when it says the hotel offers it, and I was told to walk to the gas station and get it myself. We called the front desk so that they can call a cab. Thirty minutes later when we were ready to go out, they called us and told us that they called around and every taxi driver told them that it would be about 30 minutes to arrive so she didn't order it. Then she proceeded to tell us that we should just hail a cab. We are 3 young girls stuck in a remote area because we were lied to and we were told to hail a cab! I just could not believe what I was hearing. Every morning we ordered coffee and it was COLD! We asked for drinks at the pool and the person working told me that his shift was over. This was around 5, but the pool closes at 7! I asked about the manager of the hotel and they told me that it was Ryan Stone and that he would not be in until Monday. I wanted to wait to complain because I did not want to talk to an assistant. I expressed my anger to another employee and she was really nice (Kelly). I thought that Ryan would be more compassionate and help me deal with this. Instead he was condescending and was no help at all. I told him that my entire experience of Miami had been ruined because of the staffs service and the fact that the hotel was not what they told us it would be. My entire vacation was ruined because of this hotel. For me, my hotel is one of the most important things that I look for t make sure that its everything i want. I was lied to in many ways and i am very unhappy about that. I expressed every single concern that i just mentioned above and he asked me what i wanted. I told him that I wanted to be compensated for at least a night or two and he told me that he didn't think what i was complaining about warranted that. I asked him what he thought would warrant that request and he said that if the hotel promised something and didn't deliver. Is it just me, or was he just not listening to what I was saying. After fighting for a long time, he took off $100. Really?? What is $100 after my awful experience. I despised this hotel and it made me unhappy the entire time I was in Miami. The service and staff were very unpleasant and I am very disappointed in the treatment that i received from each and everyone there with the exception of Kelly and Addie. I really don't understand who employs these people and why the staff feels like they are gods gift to the world. I spent so much money on cabs. I could have booked a much better room that was on the beach and close to everything and paid the exact same. Instead I chose this one because they LIED to me.. Please don't go here because you will be miserable.. I travel a lot and I have never complained about anywhere that i have stayed. I have stayed in places that have not been to my liking, but the staff at these places helped to make t better. This was just an all around experience. I never write reviews but this was not going to get slipped through. Everyone needs to know what type of circus these people are running at the hotel TEMPO!!! I am furious and I still cant get over it! DONT EVERY STAY HERE! I will never stay at another Rock Resort in my entire life and I will make sure that nobody i know ever stays there either!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value with great views”
Reviews.Author: JoLon
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel that we booked at a very good rate. Roomsare huge with a very modern bathroom. Hotel staff were great although reception check out was a hassle with only one person on the desk. Had a view of the cruise ship we were sailing on and the Port of Miami harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: 95rangerover
Reviews.Content: This is a great botique hotel. Good location, stunning rooms, first class service, and a great price for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: manu070
Reviews.Content: Tempo Hotel is great hotel with nice rooms, an amazing view, easy access to Miami Beach. Friendly staff and pool lounge area is a beautiful place. Good breakfast (not included, but very good for the price) and free wi-fi in the building. The bathroom is realy good, with bathtub and a good shower, but be aware: no door between bathroom and bedroom, so if youÂ´re staying with someone youÂ´re not intimate, might be a little awkward. In general, the hotel is really nice, I recommend it. If youÂ´re going in a cruise is the perfect location, itÂ´s right in front of Miami port.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to our cruise vacation”
Reviews.Author: jeclarkeca
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night, February 11, 2011 as we were embarking on a Caribbean cruise the next morning. From the moment of our arrival and baggage assistance in the valet area we felt pampered. When we stepped off the elevator in the lobby, we were greeted by a bellhop who immediately took care of our bags and we were warmly invited to the friendly reception desk for check in. All of our details were readily available in a leather-bound folder, our room keys were handed to us and we were on our way. Thank you Tim! Our bell-hop oriented us to the room, showing us all the light switches and gadgets after placing our luggage in the walk-in closet. The remote for the bathroom mirror TV did not work and it was fixed within 10 minutes!! That is service! Anyway, to make a long review short, we felt like royalty...we were treated like the most important guests of the hotel and will return in a heart-beat! Thank you Tempo! Our cruise vacation could not have started any better.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome experience”
Reviews.Author: dluvely88
Reviews.Content: I had spend a weekend at the tempo to celebrate my 23 b-day and, I must say i enjoyed every moment of it there, the bicayne suite was very nice there was not one thing i can complain about the service was great the staff was even better.Everyone made you feel welcome they all were nice the only thing that I felt wasn't that great was the veiw but if your not a picky person about that then this will be a nice little getaway for you.

Reviews.Title: “Tempo Amuse- Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Athietic15
Reviews.Content: Food was very good. Service was excllent i would def reccomend thi place to anyone.. Make sure you get reservation b/c there were only 8 tables. Very modern place and upscale

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: LB_SP_BR
Reviews.Content: The word is "disappointment". Based on the website of the hotel, Tempo Miami supposedly is a "fashionable luxury hotel" and offers "ultra-plush rooms and suites with breathtaking views of Biscayne Bay and downtown Miami" and "a lavish Spa". So, I booked a suite (see: not a room, a suite). I got a suite on the second floor (it says fifth, but in fact is the second, because there are no second, third and fourth floors). There was a highway just beside my balcony, with a lot of noise and car pollution. The view was very poor (of course, I was on the second floor). The frigobar was empty during all my stay. The Spa was closed during the most time of my stay. There was no replace of shower gel, so I had to ask and wait every time I used the bath tub. I paid for valet service when I booked, but I had to pay again at the hotel when I was informed that "this service is not included". I tried to change the suite, but it was refused. Tempo Miami is not what is sold in its website. The real delivery is much less than the website advertising. If you are looking for a real luxury hotel in Miami, try another one.

Reviews.Title: “Arguably the best hotel I have ever stayed in......”
Reviews.Author: SGG372
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights over New Year and only booked the hotel because it was near the American Airlines Arena. Managed to get a sensible price via lastminute.com. Have to say that the hotel is very good indeed, staff are very friendly and always willing to help. Special mention to Charlie the Front Office Manager and Greg the Bar Manager - both went out of their way for us. Walking distance to Bayside shopping and we will definitely be going back next time we are in Miami!!

Reviews.Title: “great pre cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: annabel2275
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Tempo for three nights before boarding the cruise ship Eclipse. my originally assigned room was odd shaped, had a king bed, no balcony. i asked if a balcony room with water view was available. management kindly provided me with a bigger, double queen room with a balcony and a port view. i was not charged the $30 per night extra. (thank you Tempo for the nice birthday present). Tempo/Marquis building houses the hotel and privately owned condos. felt like i was living in an elegant, ultra modern studio condo, not just renting a hotel room. the only non staff people i encountered during my stay were condo dwellers who were taking out their dogs. push button in room lights discrete signal in hall - red for do not disturb, green for make up room. maid service was efficient and unobtrusive. great bartender in Amuse! her wine and food recommendations were excellent. the roof top pool and hot tubs were fully operational. i enjoyed exclusive use on two nights. the open concept bathroom offers no privacy. (unless a cohabitant is banished to the balcony while other is grooming). i suggest that Tempo install a pocket door. this woud allow guests to enjoy the option of open concept or privacy. there is a people mover (automated public transit) stop directly behind the hotel. a $5 pass gives you unlimted public transit use for one day. some attractions discount admission if you arrive by publice transit. i used the urbanspoon app on my i pod to locate food and drink. the Manhattan Cafe and Republic of Beer are a short walk away from the hotel. great hotel if you are a sophisticated, independent traveller. if you want a party atmosphere the beach area would suit better.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel you can stay at in Miami! Beats the Intercontinental by far!”
Reviews.Author: DBressler
Reviews.Content: This is the most luxurious and modern hotel in downtown Miami. It's the first time I walked into a hotel room and my jaw dropped open. I stayed in room 301, which is a corner room, and it had the most spectacular view. The walls were nothing but windows... and the balcony was HUGE! I cannot tell you how comfortable the bed was... it was beyond words. Like sleeping on a cloud. And after a long day at work, it was so nice to sleep on the most comfortable bed I've ever felt. (I actually tried to remove the sheets so I could try to find the brand of mattress they use! I wanted one for my home!!) The bathroom is simply amazing. There's a TV built in to the mirror!!! And the shower/bath room is SO cool. It's not a separate area like most hotels... it's just a glass door that you open and walk into. The drain is just built in to the floor. AWESOME design!! The shower itself is a rain shower unit so you are just immersed in water when you walk in. The most amazing shower you'll ever take. And you MUST visit the pool. It's a rooftop pool that is SO peaceful... makes you feel like you're in the tropics! The surface of the pool is actually level with the ground. Never seen something like that before. Simply amazing. When I go back to Miami on business -- OR for pleasure -- THIS is where I will always stay. No more Intercontinental!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel rooms, service was OK, Spa needs work”
Reviews.Author: CPS200
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located north of the Brickell business area in an area that is somewhat quiet and most guests would need to have a car to stay here because there is nothing (restaurants, shopping, attractions) nearby. Valet parking for $20/day is available. Pros: The rooms are brand new, super clean, great beds and modern baths with awesome free standing soaking tubs. The rooms here are a lot better than those at the Mandarin or even the Four Seasons on Brickell. Cons: I think the staff could be friendlier. It doesn't feel like they have had any training in the hospitality business. It's kind of a shame because I used to stay at RockResorts in the Islands as a kid and the staff was always one of the best parts of the stay. I travel on leisure at smaller properties because I want to low-key friendly place and i don't want to be treated as just number in a big hotel. The Spa, while well appointed, had the hot tub and steam room out of service for the duration of our stay. I would stay here again. The service issues and spa issues will probably get sorted out - I think new hotels always have these types of problems. It has the potential to be one of the best boutique hotels in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “surprising”
Reviews.Author: neglakay
Reviews.Content: Rooms are big and make you feel at home. Very nice bathroom with marble walls. Very nice interior design and good choice of sanitary fixtures.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown miami stay!”
Reviews.Author: wendyf32
Reviews.Content: This was a great experience! It is the best of both worlds: Small hotel so the service is all about you but bigger hotel quality ( cant hear through he walls ect.). Went here with my boyfriend and got a GREAT GREAT deal on the jr. suite, so I guess that made our trip that much better. The room was huge! Two bathrooms and the closet could of been a room ( in some south beach hotels that is really the size of the rooms). The bathroom had a huge tub which I made sure to use and the bed was very comfy. The only two things I didn't love was when we went outside on the giant patio it was very noisy because 395 was right below but when we closed the door you couldn't here a thing which was great and we also couldn't figure out the air in the room for the longest time I think it might of been a glitch because the next day it worked perfectly and we didn't touch it. Pool was also very pretty! Make sure if you want to reach brickell use a taxi we thought we could get there by walking , lets just say we learned our lesson fast and got a taxi! Also south beach is an expensive cab ride away , we stayed here because we had plans in the downtown area not the best place to stay if you wanna be in south beach the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh, Love the pace of Tempo....”
Reviews.Author: EKelly24
Reviews.Content: Great hotel hands down. This was for my bday weekend trip and I saw a great deal on jetsetter.com for Tempo, Miami. Being that all the years I have visited Miami, I have never stayed downtown, I figured what the heck let's try it. Its a bit confusing the find at first only b/c the clear sign you see says Marquis...TEMPO is a bit hidden. The lobby is on the 3rd floor. Other than that, fantastic. We had guests visit and their parking was complimentary. Gorgeous pool/gym setup although it's still on construction mode. The room is one of the best rooms my boyfriend and I have stayed in. It's in the running with the Wynn, Las Vegas seriously. Oh we stayed in the Junior suite, extremely spacious. The staff was kind, quick and attentive. Let's hope they stay this way. As for location, well if you're going to an event at the American Airlines Arena or Adrienne Arsht Center then it's an excellent location. We walked for a few blocks but didn't find too much besides the stores at Bayside mall which is cute.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Great location! Amazing room!”
Reviews.Author: brooklynola
Reviews.Content: Swanky. Best bed we have ever slept in. Luxurious. Balcony, TV in mirror, Walk in closet, Soaking tub, and this was their standard room. I only wish I could have seen the upgrade. Valet was great. Easy, super reasonable. $20 in Miami? Unheard of. Friends visted for cocktails, they were just as wonderful with their vehicle, and complimentary. A million times better than staying on the beach. You wont get this room or service on the other side of the causeway. You can get there in 5 minutes. Hotel is situated perfectly for access to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Rooms and Beautiful Balcony Views”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel0925
Reviews.Content: Our ages: 34 and 37 (frequent travelers) My husband and I stayed at Tempo Miami pre-cruise for 2 days. We had a part ocean/downtown view balcony. The hotel room was beautiful and it felt like a second honey moon. It was very close to the port of Miami and across the street from the American Airlines Arena. We even walked to the Bayside Market and had a delicious meal at Mambo CafÃ©. PROS: Luxurious Room, very spacious, High Quality Furniture, Beautiful Views of Downtown Miami and the Ocean. Could see the cruise ships when docked from our balcony. Night shots from balcony are breath taking. Luxurious bedding. Spacious and beautiful stand up shower. Loved the built in TV in the bathroom mirror! Check in was fast and effortless. CONS: Street traffic is heavy starting at 4am and the sliding doors are NOT very good at keeping the noise out (even making sure the sliding door was shut properly). Could hear trucks passing by which woke us up and kept us up a little past 4am. We brought this to the attention of the front desk (a tall male) on the 3rd floor and asked if all rooms where as noisy (we were on the 10th floor) and his response was: "there is nothing we can do about the traffic". No attempt to make our stay more comfortable, no sympathy/empathy, no apology. We came to Tempo Miami hoping to relax, get a good night sleep and sleep in, but unfortunately we were not able to do so. If you are a really heavy sleeper or wake up before the sunrise this may not be an issue for you. In my humble opinion, if they want to categorize themselves as a 5 star hotel then they should invest on GOOD sound proof sliding doors. There was no life at the hotel: it seemed empty and the restaurant as well. We didn't run into any hotel guests during our stay other than the father and son we saw in the pool. We had breakfast at the restaurant and we were the only ones there. There were only about 4 small tables in the back of the restaurant. I was a bit confused by the layout and had to look around twice to make sure it was a restaurant. It was the most expensive breakfast I have ever had!! We do not mind paying high for a good meal, but this restaurant is very over rated and over priced. I was expecting much more after reading the reviews about the restaurant from the hotel website. We were very disappointed with the pool. It lacked maintenance and it looked nothing like in the pictures. We never bothered going in, it was very uninviting. To conclude I would have to say that overall, the luxurious rooms outweighed the cons. I would come back to Tempo in a heart beat if it wasn't because of all the noise so early in the morning. Would still recommed the hotel to early risers. I have many more beautiful pics of the room I wish I could post, but this post is limited to 3 images.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Miami”
Reviews.Author: MF_88
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the weekend and had a truly wonderful time. It was like a super luxurious second honeymoon. Walked to the Performing Arts Center for a show, walked to Bayside, and had a 5-minute drive to South Beach over the causeway. The hotel is hip and upscale and had everything we could have wanted - the view from the room was the beautiful water of Biscayne Bay. The pool area is like a private spa with cushy lounge chairs in a peaceful setting up on the 13th floor. The staff was professional and so friendly which was a nice surprise. I can't wait to go back again. I didn't think a weekend in Miami would be so much fun!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ljacobs816
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely fabulous!!!! Gorgeous rooms!! Great Service!!! We have found a new home, when traveling to Miami!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, views, and room.”
Reviews.Author: DOD629
Reviews.Content: Every staff member that we encountered was professional, courteous and very hospitable. The concierge made a great recommendation for dinner, and the bartender had some great suggestions for bars to enjoy after dinner. Valet staff was prompt and friendly. Check-in and check-out were a breeze. The room was immaculate and very well laid out. The bathroom was really cool, with two sinks, and the bathtub/shower was quite unique. The bed was very comfortable. The pools and hot tub on the 14th floor were a great touch, as well, with the water temperature being just right. Although we didn't use the fitness facility, it looked really big from the outside, with plenty of equipment. Next time we're in Miami, we will definitely stay at the Tempo.

Reviews.Title: “More than I have expected”
Reviews.Author: Vpfdm
Reviews.Content: I was worried, because there were no photos of the hotel, and only 3 reviews by the time I went there. I am happy I decided to take the chance and we found a great, friendly and beautiful hotel. The rooms are modern and the view is beautiful. The swimming pool is awesome , though it is windy up there.

Reviews.Title: “Urban Elegance”
Reviews.Author: AJAX77
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with amazing views of the harbor. The rooms are extremely spacious and the furnishings match the urban settings. I really enjoyed the 12th floor pool & fitness for and appreciate a fitness center with a view vs. the typical hotel gym tucked away in an undesirable location. The female bartender on Tuesday night was very accomodating and had a sound product knowledge. I have stayed with RockResorts before and will definitely return when visiting the area next. Thank you for a great stay...

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY!!!”
Reviews.Author: gone_with_the_wind63
Reviews.Content: We recently just arrived back home in Switzerland from a cross country tour of the US. While in Miami, my husband and I stayed at this lovely hotel. The hotel was so nice the room had a big walk in closet, comfortable bed, bathtub, ipod dock, big flat screen, and my favorite a television built into the bathroom mirror. The facility is nice although the only public places we were able to enjoy were the pool and the bar. The staff is very helpful especially arensha the concierge and the gentleman who checked us in I donâ€™t seem to remember his name but it was German. The hotel is in a soft opening so the restaurant and the spa werenâ€™t available yet those were the only bummers on our stay. Also I find it weird that they did not have a tempo sign out front, the building says markees or something like that. Overall it was a lovely stay and I look forward to returning once it is fully opened.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in the Ghetto with no restaurant, gym, business center - NOT BUSINESS FRIENDLY!”
Reviews.Author: LottaTravel10
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was awful. Not only did it take forever the livery service to find (since the name Tempo does NOT appear outside but rather the name mystique) but the hotel itself is located in an unsafe part of town. If you are traveling on business - BE AWARE: There is no restaurant in the hotel! There is no fitness facility in the hotel and NO BUSINESS CENTER. I am never staying here again - Just plain awful.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! - Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AWJ3
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was great - everyone was friendly, knowledgable, and helpful especially the bellmen. Our room was fantastic!!! It was very spacious with floor to ceiling windows that offered great views of the bay and downtown. The bathroom was huge and even had a TV in the mirror. We enjoyed sitting on the balcony and watching the cruise ships depart. I think the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The location of the hotel is great. It's about a five minute walk from a water front mall that offers a wide variety of restaurants and about a ten minute drive to South Beach.

HotelInfo.Name: Casa Moderna Miami
HotelInfo.Address: 1100 Biscayne Boulevard, Miami, FL 33132 (Formerly Tempo Miami)
